identity.name: KeyFlow
principles: Speed is King: Key checkout must be under 5 seconds
Data as Art: Sales numbers should feel like a high-score board
Clarity over Decoration: High contrast for service bay visibility
Gamification: Sales tracking should feel rewarding

usage_rules: Use Primary (Slate-900) for main actions and headings
Use Accent (Blue-600) sparingly for 'Active' states or primary CTAs
Use Surface (Slate-50) for dashboard backgrounds to reduce eye strain
Use White for cards and content containers
NEVER use gradients for backgrounds, only subtle mesh for 'Premium' areas if needed

KeyCard.styling: bg-white border border-slate-200 shadow-sm hover:shadow-md transition-all rounded-xl

SalesProgressWidget.description: Gamified progress tracker for sales goals
SalesProgressWidget.visuals: Circular progress bar or 'Race Track' linear bar

BayGrid.description: Visual representation of RV Service Bays
BayGrid.layout: Grid of boxes, occupied bays show unit info
BayGrid.interaction: Click to view details or move unit

rv_hero.usage: RV Dashboard section header or card background

key_icon.usage: Key Management section empty state or hero

instructions_to_main_agent: Implement the 'Secret Owner Access' logic in the Sidebar or Header logo component.
Use 'recharts' for the Sales Tracker visualizations.
Ensure the 'Key Checkout' modal is keyboard accessible for speed.
For the RV Service Bay, create a visual grid component where bays can be 'occupied'.
Use the provided Pexels images for the Login page and Dashboard headers to add visual polish.
Strictly follow the 'Light, Clean, Minimal' theme. Avoid dark mode unless explicitly toggled.
universal_guidelines: Do not use generic centered layouts.
Create depth through layered design elements.
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur) for modals and sticky headers.
Use 2-3x more spacing than feels comfortable.
